observation: Digital Currency Academy | DCA | Ontdek alles over Bitcoin en Crypto  Doorgaan naar inhoud Virtuele munten, reële risico’s. De enige garantie in crypto is het risico. Opleidingen Events Nieuws Kennis Over DCA Leerplatform CryptoClub Menu Cursussen & Community Beleggen in crypto Voor iedereen Leer van de beste experts in de industrie Op eigen tempo online of 1-op-1 Actieve community die je vragen beantwoord CryptoClub Community CryptoClub voordelen Testimonials Luc De Batselier Mijn eerste event van DCA bijgewoond deze avond, leuke ervaring, leerrijke content, aangename warme mensen. Ik kijk al uit naar… LEES MEER Yennicq De Cock Iedereen is welkom om in een ontspannen en open sfeer kennis op te doen en like-minded mensen te ontmoeten. Beginner… Philippe Dauwe Als ondertussen gepassioneerde cursist heb ik al enkele keren deelgenomen aan de events van DCA. Deze waren stuk voor stuk… Bruno Keupers Echt een top team van begeleiders, alles super goed… Eda Hinkova Een leuk team vol met leergierige, ambitieuze en optimistische mensen. De lessen worden op maat gemaakt en worden telkens goed… Wim Waerniers DCA is bij mij thuis langs geweest. Bij ons eerste verkennend gesprek hebben we een tweetal uur over cryptocurrencies gepraat.… Melissa Maenhout Super toffe community! Via de WhatsApp groep en Discord blijf je steeds op de hoogte. En in het Crypto Café… Grete Gielens Wil je starten met crypto maar zie je door het bos de bomen niet meer? DCA biedt je een opleiding… Ben Roers Top organisatie! Zeer… Wouter Opdenacker Ik ben helemaal fan van de DCA aanpak: stipte opvolging, vriendelijke communicatie, professioneel materiaal,… Doe zo… Previous Slide Next Slide DCA in cijfers +500 tevreden cursisten +10.000 trouwe nieuwsbrieflezers 97% tevredenheidscore Leer alles over Bitcoin Crypto Blockchain Duidelijke videocursussen om bij te leren over Bitcoin & Crypto in het Nederlands, z owel voor beginners als gevorderden! Ontdek gratis ons leerplatform! Bezoek leerplatform Gratis toegang tot alle DCA evenementen Toegang tot alle online sessies Experts die al je vragen beantwoorden Toegang tot onze exclusieve online content Actuele marktupdates en inzichten Voor slechts €149 per jaar CryptoClub info Crypto Café Zebrastraat 32, Gent Elke eerste vrijdag van de maand organiseert DCA een gezellige avond met nationale en internationale topsprekers die hun kennis over de cryptowereld komen delen! Bekijk Events Zoals gezien op Jack Dorsey’s Block voltooit de ontwikkeling van Bitcoin mining chip 24 april 2024 BRICS-landen overwegen de ontwikkeling van native crypto stablecoin FTX verkoopt locked SOL tokens via “blinde veiling” Amerikaanse Justitie vraagt 3 jaar cel voor CZ, ex-CEO van Binance Sam Bankman-Fried helpt mee in de juridische strijd tegen bekende FTX promotors Aziatische markten kunnen crypto ETF’s omarmen in navolging van Hong Kong Nieuws overzicht Zoek DCA Nieuwsbrief Ontvang gratis onze wekelijkse crypto nieuwsbrief in het Nederlands! thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain digitalcurrencyacademy.be was registered on February 12, 2021, and it has a clientTransferProhibited flag, which is a standard status for domains to prevent unauthorized transfers. The registrant's information is hidden, which is common due to privacy reasons, but the technical contact is associated with Futureweb BVBA, which seems to be a legitimate organization based on the contact details provided. This does not necessarily indicate a scam, but it is also not conclusive proof of legitimacy. Since the website doesn't show immediate red flags such as unusually low prices or unrealistic money claims, I should verify its reputation and any customer feedback to further assess its legitimacy.

People who write reviews have ownership to edit or delete them at any time, and they'll be displayed as long ..."}, {'url': 'https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/11/tech/us-digital-dollar-cbdc/index.html', 'content': 'While Yermack says a CBDC will likely call for some “thoughtful political redesign” and a transition period as nations experiment with it over the next decade, he still sees “many good reasons to do this.”
“Throw in the fact that people really don’t like using cash — the preferences of the public are pushing governments in this direction as well,” Yermack said.
 “At a very high level, a CBDC is just digital money that would be issued by the central bank,” Sarah Hammer, the managing director of the Stevens Center for Innovation in Finance at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, told CNN Business. The Fed warned specifically of potential cybersecurity risks in a January report, saying, “Any dedicated infrastructure for a CBDC would need to be extremely resilient to such threats, and the operators of the CBDC infrastructure would need to remain vigilant as bad actors employ ever more sophisticated methods and tactics.”
 A key difference from current forms of digital cash in a bank account or payment app is that the money would be a liability of the Fed and not commercial banks — hence the “central bank money.” “It would be based on the fiat currency of that country, so it would be based on the money supply — and then it would be implemented using a government database or approved private sector entities working with the government.”

While this is a good sign, it is important to be cautious, as some scam websites might fake reviews or manipulate review platforms. However, combined with the previous observations, there doesn't seem to be any indication of scam activity based on the characteristics outlined at the beginning.

There are no results from Twitter based on the search query "Digital Currency Academy". This could mean that there is limited social media presence or discussion regarding the academy on this platform, or that the search did not retrieve relevant tweets. It's not uncommon for a legitimate business to have a limited social media footprint, but it is also a potential red flag for a scam operation if there's no digital footprint at all. With the information gathered so far, there are no immediate scam characteristics present. The website provides educational content on cryptocurrencies, has positive reviews on Trustpilot, and the WHOIS information does not raise any red flags. While a lack of Twitter presence is noted, it is not necessarily indicative of a scam.
